results.title: Great Barrier Reef (Italian)
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Great Barrier Reef of Queensland is one of the great reservoirs of marine and animal life. This documentary shows in detail, the birds, fish and mammals of the area and the work being done by scientists in studying them. A long sequence deals with the life cycle of the turtle, another with the microscopic creatures of the sea.

results.title: Great Australian disasters of the 20th century
results.creator_credit: Bruce Leonard and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: As unpredictable as ultimate destiny, disasters can strike at any time. They are major misfortunes, occurrences that cause great suffering or privation, and are usually accompanied by the sudden and unexpected loss of human life. Throughout the 20th century, Australian cameramen and documentary filmmakers have recorded on film the great disasters that have befallen this nation, often at the very real risk of personal injury. This video looks at train collisions, aviation crashes, bridge collapses, mine explosions, fires, floods, droughts, earthquakes and cyclones.

results.title: Grease
results.creator_credit: A H Luff, Frank Thrower and Shell
results.brief_description: All machinery depends on bearings. Ball and roller bearings are made with the utmost care and precision. All this effort is wasted if lubricants in which they run to don’t stand up to their work. This film illustrates how different types of grease are manufactured to meet different needs; additives being put in to adapt greases for special purposes. Tests are carried out during the manufacture of grease to ensure uniformity of quality and reliability of performance.

results.title: Gravity, weight & weightlessness
results.brief_description: Defines weight as the measure of the pull of gravity. Shows how space scientists are studying gravity, weight and the effects of free fall and weightlessness, in order to launch satellites into orbit.
results.description: Defines weight as the measure of the pull of gravity. Shows how space scientists are studying gravity, weight and the effects of free fall and weightlessness, in order to launch satellites into orbit.

results.title: Gravity waves
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explore important work in the search for gravity waves and in design and construction of equipment to measure this subtle force. Includes an interview with Dr. Joseph Weber, a pioneer in gravity wave detection.

results.title: Gravity is my enemy
results.brief_description: A documentary on painter, Mark Hicks, a man essentially without nerve or muscle function below the neck. Examines his skill, his images, his life and others’ perception of him.

results.title: Gravity
results.brief_description: A variety of everyday experiences are used as an introduction to the study of the principles of gravity. Major effects of gravity on our solar system, tides and effect of distance on gravitational pull are demonstrated and explained.

results.title: Grassland regions: Farmers and herders

results.title: Grassland farming
results.creator_credit: Donald Wilder, Julian Biggs and Canada. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Helps the farmer assess his grassland farming practices and suggests ways of increasing gains. Shows why grass is the most economical livestock feed to grow and notes its importance in soil conservation. Shows how to start a good grass forage crop, the fertilizer to use, and the strip grazing method of permanent pasture using a moveable electric fence to allocate a fresh area daily.
